text: The Great Wall of Qi () is the oldest part of the Great Wall in China that is still standing. It started being built in 441 BC (during the Spring and Autumn period) by the state of Qi. It was made to defend itself against attacks from the states of Jin and Yue. It was done being built during the Warring States period and became Qi's defense against enemies states like Ju, Lu, and Chu.Ancient sites from Zhou Dynasty discovered in the Qi Great Wall in Shandong The wall goes from Guangli village of today's Changqing District, Jinan. ==References== Category:Defensive walls Category:Buildings and structures in China Category:1st millennium BC buildings and structures
title: Great Wall of Qi
